meanings.definition: To cause disorder or turmoil in (a system, process, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was disrupting the class, making it hard to focus.
meanings.sent2: The construction noise outside was disrupting my peaceful afternoon nap.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was disrupting the calm picnic by stealing all the snacks.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected power outage disrupted the entire neighborhood, plunging it into darkness.
meanings.sent5: The sudden rainstorm disrupted the outdoor wedding, forcing everyone to seek shelter.

meanings.definition: To interrupt the normal progress or activity of (something)
meanings.sent1: The phone call kept disrupting her concentration while she was studying.
meanings.sent2: The constant barking of the dog was disrupting the neighborhood's peace.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy kept disrupting the serious meeting by running around the room.
meanings.sent4: The broken air conditioner disrupted the flow of cool air into the room, making it uncomfortably warm.
meanings.sent5: The traffic jam disrupted the smooth flow of cars on the highway, causing delays for everyone.
